'''Full Circle Magazine''' is a free distribution [[Portable Document Format]] magazine that was launched in April 2007. The magazine is an independent publication and is not affliated with [[Canonical Ltd]], the sponsors of the [[Ubuntu]] [[operating system]]. It is advertising-supported and relies on volunteer writers for much of its editorial content.<ref name="Issue25" /><ref name="Ryan22May07"> {{cite web|url = http://cybernetnews.com/2007/05/22/full-circle-magazine-for-ubuntu-users/|title = Full Circle Magazine for Ubuntu Users|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = Ryan|authorlink = |year = 2007|month = May}}</ref><ref name="Canonical"> {{cite web|url = https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuMagazine|title = Ubuntu Magazine - Full Circle|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = May}}</ref>
+
'''Full Circle Magazine''' is a free distribution [[Portable Document Format]] magazine that was launched in April 2007. The magazine is an independent publication and is not affliated with [[Canonical Ltd]], the sponsors of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] [[operating system]]. It is advertising-supported and relies on volunteer writers for much of its editorial content.<ref name="Issue25" /><ref name="Ryan22May07"> {{cite web|url = http://cybernetnews.com/2007/05/22/full-circle-magazine-for-ubuntu-users/|title = Full Circle Magazine for Ubuntu Users|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = Ryan|authorlink = |year = 2007|month = May}}</ref><ref name="Canonical"> {{cite web|url = https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuMagazine|title = Ubuntu Magazine - Full Circle|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = May}}</ref>
The publication is aimed at users of the [[Ubuntu]] [[operating system]] and all its dervatives, including [[Kubuntu]], [[Xubuntu]] and [[Edubuntu]]. It focuses on product reviews, community news, how-to articles, programming and troubleshooting tips. It is available in multiple languages; the first edition was produced in English, Estonian, Romanian, Italian, Russian, Spanish, Galician, Dutch and Indonesian, but more recent issues have been available only in English, French and Russian.<ref name="Ryan22May07" /><ref name="Mini02Mar09"> {{cite web|url = http://www.ubuntumini.com/2009/03/full-circle-magazine.html|title = Full Circle Magazine|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = Ubuntu on the Dell Mini 9|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = March}}</ref><ref name="Issue0download"> {{cite web|url = http://fullcirclemagazine.org/downloads/issue-0/|title = Issue 0|accessdate = 2009-06-15|last = Full Circle Magazine|authorlink = |year = 2007|month = April}}</ref><ref name="Issue24download"> {{cite web|url = http://fullcirclemagazine.org/issue-24/|title = Issue 24|accessdate = 2009-06-15|last = Full Circle Magazine|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = April}}</ref>
The publication is aimed at users of the [[Ubuntu]] [[operating system]] and all its dervatives, including [[Kubuntu]], [[Xubuntu]] and [[Edubuntu]]. It focuses on product reviews, community news, how-to articles, programming and troubleshooting tips. It is available in multiple languages; the first edition was produced in English, Estonian, Romanian, Italian, Russian, Spanish, Galician, Dutch and Indonesian, but more recent issues have been available only in English, French and Russian.<ref name="Ryan22May07" /><ref name="Mini02Mar09"> {{cite web|url = http://www.ubuntumini.com/2009/03/full-circle-magazine.html|title = Full Circle Magazine|accessdate = 2009-06-09|last = Ubuntu on the Dell Mini 9|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = March}}</ref><ref name="Issue0download"> {{cite web|url = http://fullcirclemagazine.org/downloads/issue-0/|title = Issue 0|accessdate = 2009-06-15|last = Full Circle Magazine|authorlink = |year = 2007|month = April}}</ref><ref name="Issue24download"> {{cite web|url = http://fullcirclemagazine.org/issue-24/|title = Issue 24|accessdate = 2009-06-15|last = Full Circle Magazine|authorlink = |year = 2009|month = April}}</ref>
